title: Anel Šabanadžović
text:
Anel Šabanadžović (; born 24 May 1999) is a Bosnian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> for Greek <a href="Super%20League%20Greece%202">Super League 2</a> club <a href="AEK%20Athens%20B%20F.C.">AEK Athens B</a>.
Šabanadžović started his professional career at Željezničar, before joining AEK Athens in 2019. In 2021, he was loaned back to Željezničar.
Club career.
Željezničar.
Šabanadžović came through <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeljezni%C4%8Dar%20Sarajevo">Željezničar</a>'s youth academy, which he joined in 2007. He made his professional debut in a cup game against <a href="FK%20Gora%C5%BEde">Goražde</a> on 26 October 2016 at the age of 17 and managed to score a goal. On 24 July 2017, he made his league debut against <a href="NK%20GO%C5%A0K%20Gabela">GOŠK</a>. Šabanadžović won his first trophy with the club on 9 May 2018, by beating <a href="FK%20Krupa">Krupa</a> in <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20Football%20Cup">Bosnian Cup</a> final.
AEK Athens.
In January 2019, Greek side <a href="AEK%20Athens%20F.C.">AEK Athens</a> announced that Šabanadžović would join them the following season on a five-year contract. He made his competitive debut for the club in a triumph over <a href="Panionios%20F.C.">Panionios</a> on 7 December.
In March 2021, he was loaned to his former club Željezničar until the end of season.
International career.
Šabanadžović represented <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20football%20team">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> on all youth levels.
In March 2020, he received his first senior call-up, for <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202020%20qualifying%20play-offs">UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying play-offs</a> against <a href="Northern%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Northern Ireland</a>.
Personal life.
Šabanadžović's father <a href="Refik%20%C5%A0abanad%C5%BEovi%C4%87">Refik</a> was also a professional footballer.
Honours.
Željezničar
